metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0900 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
RubyGems version 2.6.12 and earlier is vulnerable to maliciously craftedgem specifications to cause a denial of service attack against RubyGemsclients who have issued a `query` command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5').
ruby2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
jruby package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
